text: Blonde Redhead
penny Sparkle hi hi my needle drops this
is Anthony Fantana
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for an album review of the new
blonde redhead blonde redhead isn't one
of the most widely known bands in rock
but they're almost twenty years of
material sits at a crossroad of indie
pop psychedelic rock shoegaze and this
new LP is a completely different story
this is penny sparkle and if you want to
hear noisy guitars and dissonance and
Distortion you're about 15 years too
late
may I suggest Blonde Redhead Staib ULP
seven studio albums and a soundtrack
after that album Blonde Redhead is going
new ways they are going dream pop this
80s revival and a lot of the sounds on
this LP are pretty popular right now in
independent music music but here Blonde
Redhead really does age gracefully
improves that they could still change
with the times and the change is pretty
surprising even when comparing penny
sparkle to its predecessor 23 the song
structures here are a lot more
straightforward the sounds are sweeter
there are a lot more drum machines and
the tracks all seem a little more
sequence to but I wouldn't say that has
led to Blonde Redhead losing their taste
for adventure because this thing is not
their pop album this is not gonna get
any radio play not at least commercial
radio play what makes this thing so
interesting maybe a little adventurous
for me is how quiet it is it is so bleak
and eerie and also kind of sensual which
would usually underwhelm me but the
songwriting here is really nothing to
turn your nose up at the chord
progressions are so sinister throughout
every track on this thing you've got
contrast between the chorus and the
hooks memorable lyrics great melodies
just the basics of catchy songwriting
considering that and the change in sound
that Blonde Redhead has undergone on
this LP I really think this is something
fans of beachhouse Bjork and little
dragon can appreciate which bring
me too my most surprising comparison um
when listening to this thing over and
over I found that more and more it was
kinda reminding me of Fever Ray
yeah but of course not really as eerie
or creepy more sexy instead and that's
another thing this album is sexy as hell
like the entire thing could soundtrack a
slow motion black and white lovemaking
scene in a movie
even though this is the most quiet I've
ever heard Blonde Redhead for an entire
album this LP for me just just sucked me
in it didn't so much come out to me but
it's something that you kind of have to
give your will up to submit to it's not
gonna rock you it's not gonna blare
sounds at you it's gonna hug you and
embrace you and pull you in close and
whisper sweet nothings into your ear
there is not a track on here that I
hated but I think the only thing I
really don't like about it is the the
album art this may not be one of blonde
redheads most definitive moments but I
think this proves that there's still a
force in independent music that
transcends all the buzz all the memes
and all the BS that gets a lot of
attention these days I want to see maybe
two songs underwhelmed me and there was
a track that I felt ended maybe a little
abruptly a little early like oh where
was the ending to this track it just
kind of stopped but if you get in and
just let the sensuality take over then
this is an extremely extremely enjoyable
listen you know really I was feeling
like a strong seven on this but it I'm
gonna let it squeeze by with an eight
because it really is a great great album
didn't amaze me but it is a great great
LP and I'm really happy to hear a band
that is as aged as Blonde Redhead just
still kickin ass but doing it quietly
and I kind of wonder what counts you're
Chester thinks of Blonde Redhead you
know I really do actually prefer

redhead penny sparkle forever
